SEARCH
Package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.render

Class Highlight

java.lang.Object
org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.render.Highlight
public class Highlight extends Object
This class represents an immutable multidimensional Map of highlight rules, where the value of rule is either Ansi-Style or HTML-Style (mostly the color of text).

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Highlight.Kind
    The kind of JSON or YAML tokens to highlight
    static final record 
    Highlight.Place
    This record represents a key in multidimensional Map to store and lookup the highlight-rules.
    static final record 
    Highlight.Rule
    Individual highlight-rule - the correspondence between place and style to apply.
    static enum 
    Highlight.Structure
    The target logical structure of rendered document (JSON or YAML)
    static enum 
    Highlight.Target
    The target format of output (HTML-document/HTML-fragment, console with ANSI-escape sequences, ...)

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static Highlight
    DEFAULT
    The default highlight-scheme is based on: white syntax ( '"', '{', '}', '[', ']', ',', '-', ':' ) magenta nulls blue keys of JSON and YAML mappings green values of JSON and YAML mappings and any scalars and sequence elements As for HTML-style correspondence - the settings of well-known Python-library ansi2html (/src/ansi2html/style.py) for "basic" MacOS-Terminal are used.
    static Highlight
    NONE
    no-highlighting scheme (no highlight rules)

  • Field Details

    • NONE

      public static Highlight NONE
      no-highlighting scheme (no highlight rules)

    • DEFAULT

      public static Highlight DEFAULT
      The default highlight-scheme is based on:
      • white syntax ( '"', '{', '}', '[', ']', ',', '-', ':' )
      • magenta nulls
      • blue keys of JSON and YAML mappings
      • green values of JSON and YAML mappings and any scalars and sequence elements
      As for HTML-style correspondence - the settings of well-known Python-library ansi2html (/src/ansi2html/style.py) for "basic" MacOS-Terminal are used.

  • Method Details

    • lookupValue

      public String lookupValue(Highlight.Place place)
      Parameters:
      place - a place to look up the value for
      Returns:
      the string value of ANSI-Style, HTML-Style or HTML-CSS that correspond to that place

    • highlight

      public static Highlight highlight(Highlight.Rule... rulesArr)
      A factory-method to populate the multidimensional Map of highlight rules
      Parameters:
      rulesArr - var-args-arrays of highlight rules
      Returns:
      an immutable instance of Highlight class

    • highlight

      public static Highlight highlight(Highlight base, Highlight.Rule... rulesArr)
      A factory-method to extends/overwrite the base instance of Highlight with additional (substitutional) highlight rules
      Parameters:
      base - a base instance of Highlight to extends/overwrite
      rulesArr - highlight rules to extends/overwrite with
      Returns:
      a new immutable instance of Highlight class, which is based on base
